title: Every champion is overpowered
body: Or atleast the community makes it sound like it is.

replies.body: Overpowered is rather overused. There's a lot of champions that are too strong in a particular area or in a particular circumstance, but instead of elaborating people just call OP. By that definition, any champ can be OP in the right scenario.

Seras is right, everyone has their area where they excel.

And you have to think about what actually constitutes "OP"
Is it per-game, or in general?

For example: 
Kayle's win rate is high, she has less counterplay than Yasuo, but isn't seen very much at all, so she strongly affects games she is in, but only affects very few games in total, and no one really complains about her.

Meanwhile, Yasuo's winrate is average/slightly below average, he is more counterplay than Kayle, is seen in nearly every single game, he doesnt affect the game as much _(statistically at least)_, but affects a vast majority of games, and everyone **DESPISES** him.

So, who do you consider "OP"?
The powerful champion that no one minds at all
Or the 'weaker' champion that every non-yasuo main wants deleted at any cost?

It could be argued that because of this, Yasuo actually has more power over the community than Kayle, even though he doesn't have the stronger statistics.

It make you think, what exactly are you measuring when you say "OP"?
